Community-led initiatives: Establishing community-led initiatives to address homelessness, where members of the community can volunteer their time and resources to provide food, shelter, and other basic necessities to those in need. This can be done through the establishment of community centers, food banks, and other resources that are easily accessible to homeless individuals.

Micro-housing units: Developing micro-housing units that are affordable and accessible to homeless individuals. These units can be designed to be easily built and maintained, and can be placed in areas with high rental costs and low availability of affordable housing.

Housing-first approach: Implementing a housing-first approach, where homeless individuals are provided with permanent housing before they receive any other services such as mental health or substance abuse treatment. This approach has been shown to be effective in reducing homelessness in other cities.

Rapid re-housing: Providing rapid re-housing services to homeless individuals who are at risk of becoming homeless again. This can include financial assistance, job training, and other resources to help individuals maintain their housing and prevent future homelessness.

Education and awareness: Raising awareness about homelessness and the factors that contribute to it. This can be done through public education campaigns, community outreach programs, and other initiatives that aim to reduce the stigma surrounding homelessness and encourage individuals and communities to take action to address the issue.
